alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Butler; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Escambia; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued November 30 at 4:48AM CST until November 30 at 5:30AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CST FOR BUTLER...SOUTHWESTERN MONROE...NORTH CENTRAL BALDWIN... CRENSHAW...NORTHERN ESCAMBIA...CONECUH AND COVINGTON COUNTIES... At 448 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Greenville to 9 miles southeast of Evergreen to 3 miles northwest of McCullough, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Andalusia, Greenville, Opp, Evergreen, Luverne, Frisco City, McCullough, Georgiana, Uriah, Brantley, McKenzie, River Falls, Castleberry, Excel, Red Level, Rutledge, Dozier, Repton, Heath and Gantt. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin; Butler; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Escambia; Monroe
